intro: Embreea rodigasiana, commonly known as the red-flowered embreea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking red petals and velvety leaves, which are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
